metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9049 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
libxml2 20904-GITv2.9.4-16-g0741801 is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer over-read in the xmlDictComputeFastKey function in dict.c. This vulnerability causes programs that use libxml2, such as PHP, to crash. This vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for libxml2 Bug 759398.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9049` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.10
libxml2-utils - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.10
python-libxml2 - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.10
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> probably same issue as CVE-2017-9050

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.10').
